In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Jan 27, 13:58 UTC
Update - Customer with running A10 instances are now able to migrate their instances using the instructions provided in direct communication sent on the 17th of January.

Jan 27, 09:17 UTC
Update - Workaround : During our preparation process for enabling customers to transition their workloads before maintenance, we are temporarily stopping the creation of A10 flavor based instances. If customers attempt to create new instances using any of the A10 flavors, they will receive an API message stating that the flavor is currently unavailable/ not found.

This change does not affect currently running instances, except for the inability to resize or upgrade a running instance to a higher flavor.

We will provide additional updates to inform customers when they can begin migrating their workloads, as previously communicated directly in tickets.

Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our Public Cloud offer.

Impacted customers will be sent direct communication (customer support tickets) for instructions about the maintenance.

Thank you for your understanding.

entry.title: [GLOBAL][Storage] - Object Storage S3 Standard/High Perf incident notification
entry.content:
Jan 23, 15:11 UTC
Identified - We have determined the origin of the incident affecting our Object Storage S3 offer.

Here are some supplementary details :
Start time : 01/01/2025 00:00 UTC
Impacted Service(s) : Object Storage S3
Customers Impact : Requests to our Object Storage endpoint could return the error "InvalidArgument", on different Object operations.
Root Cause : Following a recent AWS SDK upgrade, this issue is due to a new checksum enforcement in those SDKs.
Unsupported headers are:
- x-amz-content-sha256 with value STREAMING-UNSIGNED-PAYLOAD-TRAILER
- x-amz-sdk-checksum-algorithm with value CRC32
Workaround A workaround is to downgrade the version, until the feature is implemented on our side.
Max supported versions:
- boto3 1.35.99
- legacy aws cli 1.36.40
- aws cli 2.22.35
- aws-sdk-go 1.72.3
- aws-sdk-java 2.29.52
- aws-sdk-js-v3 3.726.1
- aws-sdk-net 3.7.962.0
- aws-sdk-php 3.336.15
- aws-sdk-ruby 1.177.0
Ongoing Actions : The incident has been identified and our teams are mobilized to restore service as quickly as possible.

We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution.
We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

Jan 23, 14:51 UTC
Investigating - We are currently experiencing an event affecting our Object Storage S3 offer.
Start time : 01/01/2025 00:00 UTC

Our teams are fully committed to investigating this issue and working towards a resolution as soon as possible. As investigations are ongoing, we will share any new findings or updates with you as soon as possible.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

entry.title: [GRA3/5/7/9/11][Public Cloud] - Network maintenance notification
entry.content:
Jan 23, 05:18 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.
All the services are now operational.

Jan 22, 21:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Dec 24, 10:22 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our network infrastructure.

This may temporarily affect availability.

Start time : 22/01/2025 21:00 UTC
End time : 23/01/2025 05:00 UTC
Service impact : None. Except during the rollback phase (scheduled between 01:00 UTC and 02:00 UTC), access to running PCI instances will not be possible during 1 to 5 minutes.
Service improvement : Following our continuous improvement policy of our products and services, we will carry out a network hardware upgrade in our Graveline Datacenters.

The operation is carried out in several steps:

- Step 1: Preparation of the operation (about 3 hours)
- Step 2: New hardware implementation (about 2 hours)
- Step 3: Test and activation of the new hardware (about 2 hours)
We would like to inform you that during the second phase of our upcoming operation, scheduled for between 01:00 and 02:00 UTC, a rollback may be required. In this case, instances will continue to run, but access will be temporarily impacted for a duration of less than 5 minutes.
